sites.name: The Fishbone (Rondonia, Brazil)
sites.description: The archetypal Amazon deforestation pattern spreading from Jaru.

sites.name: Soy Pinwheels (Santa Cruz, Bolivia)
sites.description: Massive radial agricultural clearing patterns in San Julian.

sites.name: Gran Chaco Vanishing (Paraguay)
sites.description: Rapid conversion of dry thorn forest to square cattle ranches.

sites.name: Palm Oil Expansion (Kalimantan, Indonesia)
sites.description: Conversion of Borneo rainforest to palm oil monoculture.

sites.name: Mennonite Colony (Masisea, Peru)
sites.description: A new, isolated clearing deep in the Peruvian Amazon.

sites.name: Xingu Indigenous Park Border (Brazil)
sites.description: Stark contrast between protected territory and outside agriculture.

sites.name: Congo Basin Roads (DRC)
sites.description: Slash and burn agriculture expanding from new logging roads.

sites.name: Rubber Plantations (Cambodia)
sites.description: Total clearing of Snoul Wildlife Sanctuary for rubber.

sites.name: Gold Mining Arc (Madre de Dios, Peru)
sites.description: Deforestation caused by illegal gold mining (distinct sandy color).

sites.name: Vancouver Island Logging (Canada)
sites.description: Patchwork clear-cutting in temperate rainforests.

sites.name: Cloud Capital (New Albany, Ohio)
sites.description: Massive Google and AWS campuses replacing farmland.

sites.description: Huge Facebook datacenter built in the high desert.

sites.name: Microsoft Project Osmium (Iowa, USA)
sites.description: Microsoft Azure expansion in West Des Moines.

sites.name: Data Center Alley (Loudoun, Virginia)
sites.description: The densest concentration of datacenters in the world (Ashburn).

sites.description: Large plateau clearing for Facebook's first custom datacenter.

sites.name: Google Council Bluffs (Iowa, USA)
sites.description: One of Google's largest global facilities.

sites.name: Microsoft Wisconsin (Mt Pleasant, WI)
sites.description: Active construction on the former Foxconn site.

sites.name: Meta Luleå (Sweden)
sites.description: Datacenter construction near the Arctic Circle.

sites.name: AWS Zaragoza (Spain)
sites.description: New Amazon Web Services region in Aragon.

sites.name: Google Quilicura (Chile)
sites.description: Google's expansion in Latin America.

sites.name: Sierra de la Culebra (Spain)
sites.description: Massive wildfire in Zamora, June 2022.

sites.name: La Palma Volcano (Canary Islands)
sites.description: Cumbre Vieja eruption covering towns in black lava.

sites.name: Camp Fire (Paradise, California)
sites.description: The deadliest wildfire in California history (Nov 2018).

sites.name: Black Summer (Kangaroo Island, Australia)
sites.description: Devastating bushfires of 2019-2020.

sites.name: Lahaina Fire (Maui, Hawaii)
sites.description: Historic fire that destroyed Lahaina town in Aug 2023.

sites.name: Fort McMurray Fire (Canada)
sites.description: The 'Beast' fire of 2016.

sites.name: Evia Island (Greece)
sites.description: Massive wildfires in August 2021.

sites.name: Pantanal Wetlands (Brazil)
sites.description: Record-breaking fires in the wetlands (2020).

sites.name: Dixie Fire (California)
sites.description: Largest single fire in CA history (2021).

sites.name: El Pont de Vilomara (Catalonia, Spain)
sites.description: Significant fire near residential areas in 2022.

sites.name: Breidamerkurjokull (Iceland)
sites.description: Retreating glacier tongue feeding Jokulsarlon lagoon.

sites.name: Columbia Glacier (Alaska)
sites.description: One of the fastest retreating glaciers in the world.

sites.name: Rhone Glacier (Switzerland)
sites.description: Dramatic retreat of a famous Alpine glacier.

sites.name: Muir Glacier (Alaska)
sites.description: Complete disappearance of the glacier from the Muir Inlet.

sites.name: Pasterze Glacier (Austria)
sites.description: Shrinking of Austria's largest glacier below the Grossglockner.

sites.name: Mer de Glace (France)
sites.description: Visible thinning of the Mont Blanc massif glacier.

sites.name: Gangotri Glacier (India)
sites.description: Source of the Ganges, retreating visibly.

sites.name: Grey Glacier (Patagonia, Chile)
sites.description: Calving and retreat in Torres del Paine.

sites.name: Sólheimajökull (Iceland)
sites.description: Accessible glacier that has retreated inland.

sites.name: Upsala Glacier (Argentina)
sites.description: Massive retreat in Los Glaciares National Park.

sites.description: The most famous example of water loss in history.

sites.name: Lake Mead (Nevada, USA)
sites.description: Historic lows showing the white 'bathtub ring'.

sites.name: Belo Monte Dam (Brazil)
sites.description: Massive flooding of rainforest to create a reservoir.

sites.name: Sau Reservoir (Spain)
sites.description: Drought emptied the lake, revealing submerged ruins.

sites.description: Rapid shrinking of the lake bed exposing toxic dust.

sites.name: Lake Aculeo (Chile)
sites.description: A lake that completely disappeared in 2018.

sites.name: Toshka Lakes (Egypt)
sites.description: Appearance of new lakes in the Sahara desert from Nile overflow.
